Title: ğŸ‡»ğŸ‡ªICC prosecutor Karim Khan -actively monitoring- situation in ...
Description: ğŸ‡»ğŸ‡ªICC prosecutor Karim Khan -actively monitoring- situation in VenezuelaThe chief prosecutor of the International Criminal Court, Karim Khan, said on Monday that he is -actively monitoring- developments in Venezuela, where security forces have launched an offensive against the opposition following alleged -fraud- in the presidential elections.In a statement sent to journalists, reported by the AFP agency, the ICC prosecutor's office stated that they are -actively following current developments and have received multiple reports of cases of violence and other allegations following the presidential elections of July 28 in Venezuela.-In addition, the statement states that Khan's office -has been in contact with the Government of Venezuela at the highest level to underline the importance of ensuring that the rule of law is respected at the current time and to emphasize that all persons must be protected from violations that may constitute crimes under the Rome Statute.-This statement comes three days after Amnesty International sent a letter to prosecutor Khan calling for -urgent action- in response to the events in Venezuela.

Title: ğŸ–¼ Tocuyito Prison: workers and machinery at full speed to receiv...
Description: Tocuyito Prison: workers and machinery at full speed to receive hundreds of detaineesHundreds of workers are deployed inside and outside the Tocuyito prison, working and moving machinery at full speed to comply with the order to leave the penitentiary in optimal conditions, in order to receive the detainees during the protests.During the tour of the exterior of the Tocuyito Prison, located in the Libertador municipality, the El CarabobeÃ±o team was unable to see the arrival of detainees or the presence of family members outside. So far, what could be observed is the conditioning of the entrance and the initial pavilion, which is already painted white and gray. In the rest of the pavilions, workers are working on the plastering.According to NicolÃ¡s Maduro, there are currently 2,229 people detained throughout the country, whom he described as -terrorists.-
